item.title: Awesome Games Done Quick 2025 Raises Over $2.5m for Cancer Charity
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/awesome-games-done-quick-2025

Charity speedrunning event Awesome Games Done Quick 2025 has come to a close, and the event has raised a huge amount of money for charity organization Prevent Cancer Foundation.

Per a press release, AGDQ 2025 has raised a grand total of $2,556,305 for the cancer charity, which advocates for cancer prevention and early detection. That's around the same amount raised during Awesome Games Done Quick 2023 and slightly more than AGDQ 2024's total.

Like last year's event (but not the previous year's), AGDQ 2025 took place over a seven-day period in Pittsburgh, PA, with over 2,000 people attending the event and "tens of thousands" of people streaming it online.

As you'd expect if you've seen an AGDQ event before, many games were streamed during this year's marathon, and some of them enjoyed some pretty wacky accompaniments too.

Highlights, as a press release points out, include Dr. Doot's saxophone-driven Elden Ring stream (which you can see below), as well as an actual opera performance by Xem upon completion of his run of Ratchet and Clank: Going Commando.

You may also have seen FunkopotamusWes playing New Super Mario Bros. Wii using his head and feet while using his hands to play the piano, then doing the same while blindfolded. No wonder the amount raised for charity was so high.

Lest you think AGDQ 2025 focused only on good games, though, think again; the Awful Block segment featured streamers playing through games like the legendarily godawful Superman 64 and the just-plain-weird Golf With Your Grandmother.

Awesome Games Done Quick 2025 concluded on Sunday morning with a Super Metroid run, which feels like a nice, classic way to bring proceedings to a close.

If you missed any of the runs that took place during AGDQ 2025, you can check them all out via the official Games Done Quick YouTube channel. You can also still make a donation to Prevent Cancer Foundation via its official website if you'd like to.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: 2024 TechRaptor Awards - Best Multiplayer
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/features/2024-techraptor-awards-best-multiplayer

As inhuman as we gamers can be in a dark, poorly lit caves, we still want to spend some time with our fellow humans like anyone else. Thankfully, each year awesome games that allow us to compete and cooperate with one another get made, some of which we'll be playing for many years to come. Here's our best multiplayer games of 2024.

Here are the nominees for TechRaptor's 2024 Best Multiplayer Award for exceptional multiplayer gameplay and design.

  • Helldivers 2 (Our Review)
  • Marvel Rivals 
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree (Our Review)
  • Tekken 8 
  • Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 (Our Review)

Check out here for our other award categories.

Third Place - Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

Developer: Saber Interactive | Release Date: September 9th, 2024

Written by Andrew Otton

It seems crazy that it took this long for someone to really nail what it feels like to play as a Space Marine for the Warhammer 40K universe. Obviously, this is a sequel to a first solid attempt at that game, but it wasn't quite there. Now, though, Space Marine 2 is the ultimate 40K fantasy.

Space Marine 2's co-op is set up in a classic way. Honestly, there's nothing more to it than you can just join up with some friends to absolutely demolish people as a squad of Space Marines. Because the gameplay is so visceral and the visual design so perfectly captures that universe, you can't help yourself but have a good time.

It isn't often we're treated with some really fun co-op experiences, but you owe it to yourself to try out Space Marine 2, especially if you're into Warhammer.

Second Place - Marvel Rivals

Developer: NetEase Games | Release Date: December 6th, 2024

Written by Robert Scarpinito

Ever since I played it while it was in beta over the summer, I felt something I hadn't felt in a while: low-pressure competitive joy. It reminds me of the early days of Overwatch (in more ways than one). No matter which character you play, it's fairly easy to feel effective, but games are also just short enough that if you royally screw up, the opportunity to redeem yourself is around the corner.

The Team-Up Abilities also feel like an innovative take on hero selection. Pairing up two heroes who benefit each other gives you a slight edge, but it never feels like it breaks the game. Instead, it's a lore-friendly way to strategize your picks, playing into the rich history of Marvel stories that are on offer.

We're just getting into season 1 now, which has introduced Reed Richards and the Invisible Woman, with The Thing and the Human Torch just around the corner. Already, that's an impressive amount of support for a hero shooter that could really shake up the somewhat stale genre.

Winner - Helldivers 2

Developer: Arrowhead Game Studios | Release Date: February 8th, 2024

Written by Dan Rockwood

In 2024, no game captured the chaos and camaraderie of fighting on a united front better than Helldivers 2. Not only is it super fun to coordinate calling in stratagems that will bomb entire acres of a map, but on higher difficulty levels Helldivers 2 requires optimized teamwork to keep from being overrun by Terminids, Automatons and, most recently, the Illuminate.

When you are battling alone, outgunned and outnumbered, there's no greater feeling than a friendly ship coming out of hyperspace, the fresh Hellpod deploying, screaming through the atmosphere like a missile until it slams into the ground, releasing a new Helldiver to help turn the tide of battle.

Helldivers 2 seamlessly integrates and relies on cross-platform coordination and cooperative play to win missions but doesn't shy away from the hilarity of accidentally (or intentionally) dropping a 500 kg bomb on one of your friends or napalming an extraction point moments before evacuation. Helldivers 2 is among the greatest multiplayer experiences of the past decade, and with frequent updates and an ever-evolving story, it shows no signs of slowing down.

There's no I in TEAM!! We're all on the case, and this is how you know it :)
